alert.note: Alert for Burleson; Lee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:14PM CDT until May 15 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Middle Yegua Creek near Dime Box affecting Burleson and Lee Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River at Morales affecting Lavaca and Jackson Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Middle Yegua Creek...including Dime Box...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Middle Yegua Creek near Dime Box. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water spills into the flood plain in the vicinity of the gage. FM 141 below the confluence with West Yegua Creek is threatened and backwater flooding up West Yegua and Turkey Creeks in Lee County is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 10.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 03/21/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Middle Yegua Creek Dime Box 10.0 9.3 Sat 8 pm CDT 10.1 8.5 5.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.
